anns.prefix: Discussions Discussions Homologous lmbU-like regulators are highly conserved proteins, and their genes widely co-exist in the BGCs of secondary metabolites or are distributed out of the BGCs, or both of them in actinomycetes which suggests that
anns.postfix: could be a new family of the transcription regulators, targeting the specific pathways or/and the other cellular metabolisms.

anns.prefix: Here, our comparative transcriptomics revealed that
anns.postfix: is a pleiotropic regulator via activating the transcription of the whole lmb cluster and regulating the transcription of non-lmb genes that scattered in the chromosome of S. lincolnensis, both involved in lincomycin biosynthesis.

anns.postfix: cluster LmbU upregulates the transcription of all genes in the lmb cluster LmbU upregulates the transcription of all genes in the lmb cluster Of 49 differential expression genes observed from ssRNA-Seq results, 29 genes are the lmb genes encompassing the entire lmb cluster.

anns.prefix: Figure 7a showed that the reads from strain SyBE2901 mapping to the
anns.postfix: cluster were extremely more than those from SyBE2904, which demonstrated that the significant change of the transcriptional levels of all 29 lmb genes between these two strains.

anns.prefix: No reads mapped to the
anns.postfix: gene showing the successful deletion of the lmbU in strain SyBE2904.

anns.prefix: When the
anns.postfix: gene was inactive in strain SyBE2904, the transcriptional levels of the rest 28 lmb genes were declined by 93.71% to 99.98% compared to SyBE2901.

anns.prefix: When the
anns.postfix: U gene was inactive in strain SyBE2904, the transcriptional levels of the rest 28 lmb genes were declined by 93.71% to 99.98% compared to SyBE2901.

anns.prefix: The genes in entire
anns.postfix: cluster were barely transcribed in SyBE2904, which were consistent with the results of semi-quantitative PCR analysis (Fig. 7c).

anns.prefix: However, PCR products of 15 TUs were not detected in strain SyBE2904 for 26 and 30 thermocycles, respectively, indicating that the transcriptions of all 15 TUs were completely blocked by the deletion of the
anns.postfix: gene.

anns.prefix: Taking together, LmbU positively and strongly regulates the transcription of the 28
anns.postfix: genes in the lmb cluster.

anns.prefix: Discussions Discussions Homologous
anns.postfix: regulators are highly conserved proteins, and their genes widely co-exist in the BGCs of secondary metabolites or are distributed out of the BGCs, or both of them in actinomycetes which suggests that LmbU could be a new family of the transcription regulators, targeting the specific pathways or/and the other cellular metabolisms.

anns.prefix: Here, our comparative transcriptomics revealed that LmbU is a pleiotropic regulator via activating the transcription of the whole
anns.postfix: cluster and regulating the transcription of non-lmb genes that scattered in the chromosome of S. lincolnensis, both involved in lincomycin biosynthesis.

anns.prefix: Homologous
anns.postfix: regulators are highly conserved proteins, and their genes widely co-exist in the BGCs of secondary metabolites or are distributed out of the BGCs, or both of them in actinomycetes which suggests that LmbU could be a new family of the transcription regulators, targeting the specific pathways or/and the other cellular metabolisms.

anns.prefix: Here, our comparative transcriptomics revealed that LmbU is a pleiotropic regulator via activating the transcription of the whole
anns.postfix: cluster and regulating the transcription of non-lmb genes that scattered in the chromosome of S. lincolnensis, both involved in lincomycin biosynthesis.

anns.prefix: The positive regulation of LmbU on the lincomycin biosynthesis was firstly confirmed by the
anns.postfix: deletion which abolished lincomycin production, and validated by the lmbU complementation and overexpression which restored and increased the titers of lincomycin, while no obvious morphology changes were observed after genetic manipulation in S. lincolnensis.

anns.prefix: It was consistent with the previous reports on the
anns.postfix: deletion and overexpression strains [6].

anns.prefix: To obtain the insight on the regulatory properties of LmbU on lincomycin biosynthesis, analysis of comparative transcriptomes between the original strain and the
anns.postfix: deletion strain was performed in this study.

anns.prefix: Unexpectively, LmbU positively regulates all of the 28
anns.postfix: genes as the regulatory targets, including the structural genes encoding enzymes for catalyzing biosynthesis of lincomycin, and resistance genes (lmrA, lmrB, and lmrC) in the lmb cluster.

anns.prefix: The 3.06-kb PCR fragment from the upstream (1105 bp) to the downstream (1275 bp) of
anns.postfix: was amplified from the genomic DNA of S. lincolnensis (isolated by Kirby mix procedure [48]) using primers DU-F and DU-R (Additional file 1: Table S2), digested by EcoR I, and cloned into SuperCos1 to yield vector pCosU. Using pIJ773 as template, the fragment acc(3)IV-oriT with 39-bp homologous sequences of lmbU at each terminus was amplified by primers QU-F and QU-R, and transformed into E. coli BW25113/pIJ790/pCosU. The lmbU gene on pCosU was replaced with acc(3)IV-oriT through the homologous recombination, resulting vector pAP07.

anns.prefix: Here, our comparative transcriptomics revealed that LmbU is a pleiotropic regulator via activating the transcription of the whole lmb cluster and regulating the transcription of non-lmb genes that scattered in the chromosome of

anns.prefix: The positive regulation of LmbU on the lincomycin biosynthesis was firstly confirmed by the lmbU deletion which abolished lincomycin production, and validated by the lmbU complementation and overexpression which restored and increased the titers of lincomycin, while no obvious morphology changes were observed after genetic manipulation in
Different from those reported LmbU-like proteins, LmbU in
anns.postfix: acts as a positive cluster-scale regulator for lincomycin biosynthesis.

anns.prefix: The 3.06-kb PCR fragment from the upstream (1105 bp) to the downstream (1275 bp) of lmbU was amplified from the genomic DNA of
anns.postfix: (isolated by Kirby mix procedure [48]) using primers DU-F and DU-R (Additional file 1: Table S2), digested by EcoR I, and cloned into SuperCos1 to yield vector pCosU. Using pIJ773 as template, the fragment acc(3)IV-oriT with 39-bp homologous sequences of lmbU at each terminus was amplified by primers QU-F and QU-R, and transformed into E. coli BW25113/pIJ790/pCosU. The lmbU gene on pCosU was replaced with acc(3)IV-oriT through the homologous recombination, resulting vector pAP07.
